comments:
We've seen the following exception logged on rare occasions when our deferred tree is updating:

Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Index out of bounds
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3531)
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3465)
at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3436)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Widget.error(Widget.java:663)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree.createItem(Tree.java:708)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.<init>(TreeItem.java:192)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.TreeItem.<init>(TreeItem.java:185)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.createNewRowPart(TreeViewer.java:733)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.newItem(TreeViewer.java:287)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.createTreeItem(AbstractTreeViewer.java:805)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.createAddedElements(AbstractTreeViewer.java:374)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.internalAdd(AbstractTreeViewer.java:265)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TreeViewer.internalAdd(TreeViewer.java:581)
at org.eclipse.jface.viewers.AbstractTreeViewer.add(AbstractTreeViewer.java:139)
at org.eclipse.ui.progress.DeferredTreeContentManager$3.runInUIThread(DeferredTreeContentManager.java:308)
at org.eclipse.ui.progress.UIJob$1.run(UIJob.java:94)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.RunnableLock.run(RunnableLock.java:35)
at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Synchronizer.runAsyncMessages(Synchronizer.java:123)

(For reference, this was originally reported as Jazz defect #22519.)
Is there anything else in your log?  Does this still happen when running with Eclipse Platform 3.3 M7 or later? See bug 154571.
This was reported against v20070502, which I believe is Eclipse 3.3 M7. No other information, sorry.
Please reopen if this happens again or when you have more information.
This continues to happen sporadically. We're now running on Eclipse 3.3.1.
Could this be a duplicate of bug 205700? Do you have a sorter set on that tree? Could it be that some of the elements passed to add() are already in the tree?
It's definitely possible that this is the same bug. With a patched plugin from the 3.3.1 stream, I could test to see if the fix from bug 205700 fixes the problem we're seeing.

Created an attachment (id=84096)
patched JFace plug-in

Jared, can you try running with this plug-in?

(In reply to comment #8)
> Will do, thanks.

Did this fix the problem?

I've been running both with and without the patch and I haven't seen the bug in either case recently. There must be something specific which makes this occur... something I haven't been doing lately. :(
